Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2013 12:56PM BigMom916 wrote: Thanks so much for your care and encouragement. I will follow up with your suggestions. I like your words that the treatment is about "control and quality of life"....a balance and that really is need to hear is possible.
Posts.Title: Metastatic Breast Cancer with bone mets BigMom916 pajim

Posts.Content: BigMom916 wrote: I am having a terrible time taking the prescribed Xeloda. I also receive Zometa monthly. I have little to no appetite, nausea, stomach pain, weight loss and fatigue I had spinal irradiation completed last week and now I am experiencing burning throughout my throat and into my stomach. It hurts to swallow. I decided to stop the Xeloda today and will discuss this with my doctor. She keeps telling me I "look great" but don't think she is paying any attention to my symptoms. I feel terrible. I feel much sicker than I did before treatment. Has anyone had trouble taking Xeloda? Does anyone have any advice for me? I'm looking for quality of life on a treatment ...Help! I should add that the bone mets are not hormone receptor positive so can't use targeted therapy Dx 12/16/2008, ILC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 1, 0/4 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 1/16/2009 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel; Mastectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Metastatic Breast Cancer with bone mets BigMom916 pajim

Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2013 03:43PM BigMom916 wrote: I think I am not expressing myself . I feel better the one week I am off the Xeloda which is when I usually see her. She says"you look good" and I hold back on saying but I feel lousy and here is why. Visits are fast paced and she tends to be defensive over any questioning. I am going to try to see her this week and be more clear. Thanks
